item.title: Spark on Kubernetes - better handling for node shutdown
item.description: Spark 3.1 on the Kubernetes project is now officially declared as production-ready and Generally Available. Spot instances in Kubernetes can cut your bill by up to 70-80%¬†if you are willing to trade in reliability. The new feature -¬†SPIP: Add better handling for node shutdown¬†(SPARK-20624) was implemented to deal with the problem of losing an executor when working with spot nodes - the need to recompute the shuffle or cached data.
item.content:encoded: Spark 3.1 on the Kubernetes project is now officially declared as production-ready and Generally Available. Spot instances in Kubernetes can cut your bill by up to 70-80%¬†if you are willing to trade in reliability. The new feature -¬†SPIP: Add better handling for node shutdown¬†(SPARK-20624) was implemented to deal with the problem of losing an executor when working with spot nodes - the need to recompute the shuffle or cached data.

item.title: Python - Churn prediction with Graphlab
item.description: Churn prediction is the task of identifying whether users are likely to stop using a service, product, or website. With Graphlab toolkit, you can start with raw (or processed) usage metrics and accurately forecast the probability that a given customer will churn.

item.title: CTB-Locker is back: the web server edition
item.description: Cryptolockers have become more and more sophisticated, bypassing system protections and terrifying anyone in their path. TeslaCrypt, CryptoWall, TorrentLocker, Locky and CTB-Locker are only some of the malware we have protected from for the past two years. We have seen many shapes and colors of cryptolockers, but the new CTB-Locker variant says it all. The world of cybercriminals is investing in how to reinvent cryptolockers.
item.content:encoded: Cryptolockers have become more and more sophisticated, bypassing system protections and terrifying anyone in their path. TeslaCrypt, CryptoWall, TorrentLocker, Locky and CTB-Locker are only some of the malware we have protected from for the past two years. item.title: Minimalism in Web design: past and future
item.description: Minimalism is one of the most enduring visual frameworks in Web design given its timeless elegance and clear presentation of content. While cycles of popularity come and go, the design technique is a classic and lasting visual philosophy for designers across all specializations and industries.

item.title: Bigdata - Getting Started with Spark (in Python)
item.description: Hadoop is the standard tool for distributed computing across really large data sets and is the reason why you see "Big Data" on advertisements as you walk through the airport. It has become an operating system for Big Data, providing a rich ecosystem of tools and techniques that allow you to use a large cluster of relatively cheap commodity hardware to do computing at supercomputer scale. Two ideas from Google in 2003 and 2004 made Hadoop possible: a framework for distributed storage (The Google File System), which is implemented as HDFS in Hadoop, and a framework for distributed computing (MapReduce).
item.content:encoded: Hadoop is the standard tool for distributed computing across really large data sets and is the reason why you see "Big Data" on advertisements as you walk through the airport. It has become an operating system for Big Data, providing a rich ecosystem of tools and techniques that allow you to use a large cluster of relatively cheap commodity hardware to do computing at supercomputer scale. Two ideas from Google in 2003 and 2004 made Hadoop possible: a framework for distributed storage (The Google File System), which is implemented as HDFS in Hadoop, and a framework for distributed computing (MapReduce).

item.title: The Myth of the Full-stack Developer
item.description: My defensive tendencies are normally put on high alert when I hear that magic phrase. Stacks are a lot bigger than what they used to be, and being able to claim one has acquired refined skills at every layer of web development is certainly not a small claim. Does this mean you have a broad range of skills or you specialise in everything?

item.title: Firefox 30 arrives with sidebars button, GStreamer 1.0 support, and quickshare in context menu on Android
item.description: Mozilla today officially launched Firefox 30 for Windows, Mac, Linux, and Android. Additions include a button for direct access to sidebars (social, bookmark, and history), support for GStreamer 1.0, and new quickshare buttons in the context menu on Android.
item.content:encoded: Mozilla today officially launched Firefox 30 for Windows, Mac, Linux, and Android. Additions include a button for direct access to sidebars (social, bookmark, and history), support for GStreamer 1.0, and new quickshare buttons in the context menu on Android.
